Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: glazed black; exterior: from top, part of undetermined motif followed by single brown lines; below, black-figure decoration consisting of possible bird (only head and chest remaining), to right and looking back.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 117, no. 12, pl. 14.L)
CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 9, no. 5, pl. 9, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.205) (phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.121.11 (old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
